data.title: Tree County Players announce new season
authors: Bill Rethlake, Greensburg Daily News, Ind
data.meta_description: Aug. 8—GREENSBURG — The Tree County Players announced plans for their 2024-2025 season at their annual members meeting Sunday, August 4, Key leadership for the thespian troupe presented video highlights of season 2023-2024 and announced the theatrical/musical events comprising their 53rd season of entertainment for the community. Tree County Players has presented plays each year since May 1971 ...
data.text:
Aug. 8—GREENSBURG — The Tree County Players announced plans for their 2024-2025 season at their annual members meeting Sunday, August 4,

Key leadership for the thespian troupe presented video highlights of season 2023-2024 and announced the theatrical/musical events comprising their 53rd season of entertainment for the community.

Tree County Players has presented plays each year since May 1971 when the group was founded by Cleo Duncan and Sue Burdett.

It was first named "Decatur County Civic Theater" until Frances Lindner of St. Paul won a contest to rename the group "Tree County Players" in the fall of that year.

In 1989, TCP purchased a 3,200-square-foot building on S. Monfort Street, Greensburg, to be utilized as a storage and rehearsal space pending a performance space.

Exactly 27 years later, the TCP Board toured the former Wesleyan Church at 634 W. Main Street, Greensburg, and found it appropriate for a community playhouse.

Duncan spearheaded a capitol campaign to purchase the building, and the rest is history.

Tree County Players 2024-2025 season offers something for everyone with several community partnerships.

—Mystery at the Museum: Murder at the Manor (community partnership with the Historical Society of Decatur County), September 6 to 8. Directed by Karen Matthews and Lauren Huffmeyer.

—Almost, Maine, October 3 to 5. Directed by Megan Gehrich and Rocky Miano. Written by John Cariani, Almost, Maine is a series of nine short plays surrounding love and relationship dynamics, specifically the sadness and hilarity of love.

—Front and Center Players: Variety Show (community partnership with The ARC of Decatur County), November 1 and 2. Directed by Jennifer Maddux, Carrie Shumaker and Bryan Collins.

—A Merry Country Christmas, December 6 and 7. Directed by Dennis Fogle.

—Agatha Christie's The Mousetrap, February 6 to 9. Directed by Jeff Lincourt. As news spreads of a murder in London, a group of seven strangers finds itself snowed in at a remote countryside guesthouse. When a police sergeant arrives, the guests discover, to their horror, that a killer is in their midst. One by one, the suspicious characters reveal their sordid pasts.

—Feldman Music Studio: Student Showcase (community partnership with Feldman Music Studio), April 12. Directed by Willie Feldman.

—MTI's Raise Your Voice: A Youth Musical Theater Revue, June 12 to 15. Directed by Amy Borns and Morgan Straber.

—TCP's Youth Theater Camp, July 23 to 25. Directed by Morgan Straber.

For more information about Tree County Players, visit www.treecountyplayers.com or look for them on social media.
